title: How to Pronounce the Fear of Long Words

steps.title: Know the word.
steps.content: Know the word. It is hippopotomonstrosesquipedaliophobia . [1] X Research source

steps.title: Break the word into up into its root words.
steps.content: Break the word into up into its root words. Hippopoto-monstro-sesuiquipedalio-phobia . Hippopoto is the misspelled form of Hippopotamus , Monstro comes from the Latin Monstrum , meaning Monster , Sesquipedalio comes from Sesquipedalian , a very long word, and lastly Phobia , an extreme or irrational fear of something. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Break the word up into easy to pronounce pieces.
steps.content: Break the word up into easy to pronounce pieces. Hippo-poto-monstro-sesqui-pedalio-phobia.

steps.title: Start with Hippo.
steps.content: Start with Hippo . It is pronounced Hi-poh . [3] X Research source

steps.title: Follow with Poto.
steps.content: Follow with Poto . Pronounce it as Po-toh .

steps.title: Then there is Sesqui.
steps.content: Then there is Sesqui . Pronounce Ses-kwee .

steps.title: Say Pedalio.
steps.content: Say Pedalio . This is pronounced as Peh-dah-leejoh .

steps.title: Finish with Phobia.
steps.content: Finish with Phobia . Say it like Foh-beejah .

steps.title: Pronounce the whole word.
steps.content: Pronounce the whole word. Hi-poh-po-toh-mon-stroh-ses-kwee-peh-dah-leejoh-foh-beeja . [4] X Research source

steps.title: Practice the pronunciation until you can say the word without hesitations.
steps.content: Practice the pronunciation until you can say the word without hesitations. [5] X Research source
